Name: Murder Mystery Evening: The Curse of the Mummy
Description:
Host your own murder mystery evening. An "investigator" narrates the action on CD, which directs the play and sets the mood for a unique dinner party experience. Includes: invitations, host instruction booklet, character booklets, name tags, and themed recipes.

Similar to other murdery mystery games, though in this dinner party style game the action is more scripted.  One player takes the part of the investigator, who narrates the story along with a CD that directs play and sets the mood.

Styled after turn-of-the-century archeologists and the popularization of everything Egypt that followed.

Includes: CD, invitations, host instruction booklet, character booklets, name tags, and themed recipes.

Name: Murder Mystery Evening: Dead on Time
Description:
Host your own murder mystery evening. An "investigator" narrates the action on CD, which directs the play and sets the mood for a unique dinner party experience. Includes: invitations, host instruction booklet, character booklets, name tags, and themed recipes.

Similar to other murdery mystery games, though in this dinner party style game the action is more scripted.  One player takes the part of the investigator, who narrates the story along with a CD that directs play and sets the mood.

This particular title is themed in the Cold War era Soviet Union.

Includes: CD, invitations, host instruction booklet, character booklets, name tags, and themed recipes.

Name: Murder Mystery Evening: The Shotgun Affair
Description:
Host your own murder mystery evening. An "investigator" narrates the action on CD, which directs the play and sets the mood for a unique dinner party experience. Includes: invitations, host instruction booklet, character booklets, name tags, and themed recipes.

Similar to other murdery mystery games, though in this dinner party style game the action is more scripted.  One player takes the part of the investigator, who narrates the story along with a CD that directs play and sets the mood.

Includes: CD, invitations, host instruction booklet, character booklets, name tags, and themed recipes.

Name: Amoeba
Description:
Amoeba is an abstract strategy game for 2-6 players. Players take turns placing a pyramid, scoring their turn, and adding another poker chip to the playing area. A pyramid may be placed on any empty poker chip. When adding a new chip to the playing area, it must touch at least two other poker chips.

Game System

    Icehouse Pieces

Name: Zbuduj swój Kaczogród
Description: Zbuduj swój Kaczogród (English: Build Your Own Duckburg) is a collectible mini card game for children added to a few subsequent issues of "Kaczor Donald" magazine (English: Donald Duck). Players build the town of Kaczogród (English: Duckburg), where the action of the Donald Duck comic books takes place. Every turn they draw up to 5 cards in hand and either place the location card (city service card, building card or special building card) adjacent to the city or play the event card. Game is won by the player with the most victory points, counted for every type of buildings in city and for every special building.

Name: Glich
Description: Through the use of 'link' cards, players navigate the Internet (depicted as a web on the board) in order to visit hardware sites and purchase all the components needed for a computer system.  Some parts of the Internet are password protected, and can only be traversed if you received an appropriate password via e-mail.  But be warned, some sites and e-mail may cause a 'glich', which could cost you your valuable hardware.

Name: Små kloka barn på bokstavsjakt
Description: Find the letters needed to complete the words on your game board. Only problem is, the ABC-thief has taken all the letters. Fortunately there is a hole in his bag and all the letters are scattered on the streets of the city. The first one to find all the letters for the words on the game board wins and is honoured with a song by the other players.

Name: Sulawesi
Description: Players simulate the planting and harvesting of the rattan palm in Sulawesi, Indonesia. A player's turn essentially consists of two parts: A move in which one of the player's meeples moves either on a path or through the jungle, cutting down all or some (or none) of the rattan on the way; this costs rattan itself. Afterwards, the player rolls four dice to plant four new rattan plants anywhere on the board, but only in places adjacent to as much rattan as one die shows. Whoever  reaches the sum of 18 rattan pieces first, wins.

Name: Jet Set
Description: In this game, the players have to place their cards onto stacks on the table. This is possible if the number on the card is half or double the value of the top card of any stack and the same color code. If that is not possible, players start new stacks, which count negative points at the end of the game. "Stop" cards close a stack, which then doesn't count negative points anymore. Whoever reaches a certain number of points, for example 25, loses.

Name: American Kennel Club DVD Board Game
Description:
This entertaining family DVD board game gives families the opportunity to learn interesting facts about dog breeds registered with the AKC. Using game pawns, players must collect doggie treats and race around the game board to be the first handler to get their dog to the finish line

Incorporates aspects of the AKC such as agility obstacles and best in show competitions. Some spaces on the game board will ask players to interact with the DVD Hoc Bullet: Includes game board, pawns, DVD, cards, tokens/doggie treats and dice

For 2-4 People

Name: Nýja fótboltaspilið
Description: This game (The New Football Game) is a simple football game for two players. The board is folded with the 'football field' on one side. The field consists of evenly spread circles connected with lines where the players can pass the ball. The players roll the die and move the ball accordingly and try to score the most goals to win the game.

Name: Wacky Stacky
Description: Wacky Stacky is a novel take on the classic block-stacking game Jenga.  It utilizes a blind-fold and hidden instructions printed on the blocks.  Each block changes the game in some fashion, be it switching the active player, passing the blindfold, and more.

Name: Djavha
Description:
A new millennium has begun on your planet! Order has seized control of your lives and Chaos has lost much ground, but still lingers in the shadows. In no event can the balance of your world tip wholly towards either force, as this would spell your immediate destruction. Your world is ruled by duality. Now the time has come to awaken the Warriors of Balance.

Djavha is a game with 54 cards where each player must use the powers of Ordre and Chaos as represented on each card to get rid of all of the cards in their possession. The game is one of rank and power. The first participant to get rid of all of their cards becomes the Master and the last person to get rid of their cards becomes the Damned.

Name: Kitchen Panic
Description:
A racing game of skill and speed.  Use your chef to pick up balls to fill your pan. The first person to get 5 balls in their pan wins.

For children 5 and up.

Name: Dig & Play Medieval Quest
Description: Dig and excavate 12 medieval soldiers, assemble a cardboard castle and play an exciting medieval quest board game.  The board game mainly consists of rolling a die and moving your 6 soldiers (6 gold and 6 silver)around the board to try and be the first to get all 6 in the castle.  Soldiers can lose their turn or be sent back to the starting space.

Name: Life-Boat Ludo
Description: Players are sea rescuers saving ships' crews from sea catastrophes.  Players must rescue all four of their ships crews and return to base before the other players get to their ships needing help.  The first player to return with all survivors wins the game.

Name: Handboltaspilið
Description: This is a two player game where each player takes on the role of a handball team, rolling dice to score goals and win the game.

Name: Kjördæmaspilið
Description: Kjördæmaspilið (The District Game) is a political game where players try to win the elections running a political party of their choosing.

Name: Ortografia
Description:
Ortografia is a polish board game designed for children (9-12 years old) to be useful tool in learnig the polish ortography. 
Childrens have to choose witch type of cards do they want (h/ch or o/u). For playing they use two sided board where are special places for placing the cards with words.
The winner is child with the biggest numner of points (correctly written words).

Name: Only in New York
Description:
The game that blends the savvy and smarts needed to make it only in New York City.  Players move around the city answering trivia questions about the city and receive the letters N.E.W Y.O.R.K by answering at least one question correctly.

Players must travel in each of the outer boroughs (the bronx, Queens,Brooklyn and staten island) and in the outlying counties (Nassau, west chester and hudson).  After going to these seven areas, they must then return to Central Park in Manhattan to answer a final question chosen by your opponent to win the game.

Name: Sorts for Kids
Description:
Sorts for Kids is a party game based on ordering items in lists.

There are three types of topic cards:
Blue topic cards - Four colour coded list items which need to be sorted into the appropriate order (e.g. Sort these things by their length - a stick of blackboard chalk, a dessert spoon, a one metre rules, a computer keyboard)

Yellow topic cards - A statement is made and four possibilities are given, but only two of them are correct.  You need to choose which ones (e.g. which two of these animals can run faster than a rabbit?)

Red topic cards - Line up ( Sort yourselves by the number of buttons you have on the clothes you are wearing right now)

The reverse side of the card shows the correct answer, or in the case of the red topic card the reward.
Families: Versions & Editions: Junior Versions of Grown-Up Games

Name: Sturlungaspilið
Description:
Sturlungaspilið is a game about the Age of Sturlungar, a time of civil war in Iceland in the 12th century. This civil war ended in 1262 when Iceland became a part of the Norwegian kingdom.

Players take the part of one of the ruling families or clans and try to gain dominion in Iceland by buying or occupying the majority of areas in the game.

Name: Crimson Skies: Behind the Crimson Veil
Description: A supplement to FASA's 1998 Crimson Skies, Behind the Crimson Veil adds information about the 4 successful pirate gangs - including the Black Swans - with various scenarios.  It also new airplanes, like the fiery GM-1 Tempest.  The supplement include the "school of engineering"; manufacturers share their construction secrets, and details on new components with special characteristics and limits.  More detailed information is provided on boarding parties with zepplins, in this supplement.

Name: Junior Auto Race Game
Description: Players take on the role of race car drivers attempting to reach the finish.  Each player spins the wheel which tells them which cards advance one space along the a U-shaped track with 16 spaces from start to finish.  Players must beware of landing on the Blow Out or Accident spaces which will halt their progression for a turn.  Like all races, the first racer to reach the finish line wins!

Name: UNO: The Dark Knight
Description:
Based on the 2008 film "The Dark Knight."

Includes the exclusive The Joker's wild card, which forces an opponent to draw cards until they draw a card of the color of your choice.
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Crazymino
Description:
The game is played with squared tiles bearing numbers similar to Quad-ominoes upon a coloured board. Scoring is done by arrangement of tiles, and some zones of the board forces the player to draw cards and to follow their instructions, or to draw a Joker tile.

The winner is the first to reach 1000 points

Name: Turning The Tide
Description:
Turning The Tide Scenario Pack

Turning the Tide includes 20 scenarios that are updates to the Advanced Squad Leader system of Squad Leader scenarios from Cross of Iron, Crescendo of Doom, GI: Anvil of Victory, the 100 Series, the 200 Series, and the “Rogue 200” scenarios. These updated scenarios have not previously seen print in ASL form, although two have been available for download from the MMP website. They range from the beginning of World War II in Poland through the Russian offensive in the Ukraine across the Dnieper River, following the Battle of Kursk in 1943.

Turning the Tide’s scenarios feature the forces of Poland, Belgium, The Netherlands, Norway, France, Britain, Greece, Russia (and Russian partisans), and the United States all battling Germany. Scenarios take place in both night and day, winter and summer, and involve cavalry, motorcycles, air support, parachutes, and gliders as well as armor clashes and infantry battles. Most take place in the countryside, but there are actions in cities and towns as well as forests and mountains, and some involve seizing bridges over rivers and canals.

The majority of the scenarios can be played with just boards 1-5, and only two require a board that was not part of the original SL-GI system. None of these scenarios use overlays.

Whether you cut your teeth on Cross of Iron or picked up Beyond Valor for the first time yesterday; whether you prefer Matildas vs. PzKpfw IIs or T 34s vs. PzKpfw IVs; Turning the Tide’s array of interesting scenarios has something for you.

Twenty-five years in the making, and a true labor of love from the original ASL grognard Jim Stahler, Turning the Tide is the penultimate step in converting SL-GI scenarios to ASL. We are already working with Jim on a follow-on scenario bundle to cover September 1943 through May 1945 to complete the ASL updating process.

A fairly complete list of all original Squad Leader scenarios and their ASL scenario numbers and publication data can be found at:
http://tacticalwargamer.com/boardgames/squadleader/squadleaderscenarios.htm

The scenarios in Turning the Tide are:

U14 Sacrifice of Polish Armor 
U15 Battle for the Warta Line 
U16 Under Cover of Darkness 
U17 Resistance at Chabrehez 
U18 Assault on a Queen 
U19 Hasty Pudding 
U20 Fighting at World's Edge 
U21 The French Perimeter 
U22 Road to Kozani Pass 
U23 Rehearsal for Crete 
U24 Traverse Right..Fire! 
U25 Breakout from Borisov 
U26 Bald Hill 
U27 A Winter Melee 
U28 Sowchos 79 
U29 Night Battle at Noromaryevka 
U30 Swatting at Tigers 
U31 The Front in Flames 
U32 Disaster on the Dnieper Loop 
U33 The Bukrin Bridgehead

Name: Fanatic Pack #1
Description:
From the Fanatic Enterprises web site:

FANATIC PACK #1 features 12 scenarios on card stock. Each scenario has been thoroughly playtested and balanced for your enjoyment. Here are summaries of the actions depicted:

FE1 A Victory for Early Polish Armor: It is 1920 and the Russian army is invading the fledgling country. But the tough Polish Army is going to fight for its independence with every tool it possesses. You want tin can action? Here it is! Uses boards 46 and 11 and requires use of Axis Minor and Italian counters.

FE2 Dans La Bataille, Pour La Patrie: May 1940, the French have their one opportunity to crush the German assault. The successful attack through the Ardennes is moving to the sea, cutting the French in half. However, this gives the French a singular opportunity for counterattack. Can DeGaulle marshal his forces for an effective attack? Requires board 12 and 4 and the French and German counters.

FE3 The Border Forts: November 1940 was a very bad month for Mussolini. His attack in Greece was failing, his battle fleet was heavily damaged at Taranto and his airforce was taking a beating in England. Only in the far deserts of East Africa was he enjoying any victory. Uses boards 27 and 31 and requires Italian and British Counters.

FE4 Whirling Dervishes: February 1941 finds the newly formed Free French Army looking for a way to contribute to the Allied cause. Bold action is taken from the colony of Camaroon. Using odds and ends of vehicles they traverse the desert and surround an isolated Italian fort. The defenders hang on until the cavalry arrive in the form of an Auto Saharan Company. Uses boards 26 and 28 and requires Italian and French counters.

FE 5 Beyond the Call of Duty: its April 1941 and the Germans are preparing to invade Yugoslavia. Just before the invasion assault troops cross the border and attack the fortifications along the frontier. Requires board 11 and 18 and uses Allied Minor and German Counters.

FE6: Cavalry Charge at Mussino: During the crucial battle in front of Moscow in November 1941, the Soviets are boosted by the arrival of Mongolian Cavalry units from the far east. However the cavalry would pay dearly in this action as they assault the dug-in German guns in a bloody cavalry charge. Uses boards 19 and 42 and Russian and German counters.

FE 7 Quick and Dirty: It is the Spring of 1942 and the Japanese have released their own form of Blitzkrieg covering much of the globe with their power. March finds them invading Java and in this opening skirmish a Japanese reconnaissance patrol races a Dutch force to capture a bridge. Uses Board 47 and Japanese and Allied Minor counters.

FE 8 Soebang Serenade: The only major armor clash of the Dutch East Indies Campaign occurred at Soebang on March 2, 1942. The counterattacking Dutch run into Japanese forces consolidating their control near the Soebang airfield and a melee ensues. Uses boards 24, 37 and 38 and uses Japanese and Allied Minor counters.

FE 9: Blackforce Counterattack: British and Japanese tangle in this PTO action. British armor and infantry slug it out as the Japanese try to protect their bridgehead. Uses boards 38 and 40 and British and Japanese counters.

FE 10: An Abandoned Army: The surrender of Allied forces on Java did not end the fighting in the Dutch East Indies. A desperate force of Dutch and native troops struggles to hang together on the island of Sumatra. The Japanese are poised to crush them along with the help of the locals. An Urban Guerrilla for the PTO with partisan units popping out of nowhere to attack the Dutch. Uses board 32 and Japanese and Allied Minor units along with partisan counters.

FE11: Italian Winter: The German SS Police force was a fearsome and tough group. This action covers a battle between the SS Police force using captured T-34's against a dug in Italian partisan force with some tricks of their own. Uses board 50 along with Italian, German and Russian counters.

FE 12: Once More into the Breach: Late in the war the Germans were desperate. Attacked from all sides they threw what they could at the tidal wave of Russians attacking from everywhere. This action covers a rescue operation as the SS try to reach a surround group of SS before they can be annihilated

Expands:

    Advanced Squad Leader

Name: Secret Service
Description:
Description from the back of the card case:

"The world of spies and thrilling missions.

Take control of a spy organization of your own design. Use equipment cards to arm your agents with special powers and send them to exciting cities around the world. Let them battle your opponents and complete their mission to fulfill your goal...

There are four different basic decks [Asia, Europe, Russia, USA], each presorted to give you everything you need to start the game. You can easily build your own deck - choose a powerful group of cards - none of your opponents will know what he has to expect..."

Name: Skizzo
Description:
Skizzo is a humorous kind of game of goose. There are a few choices about moving after rolling the dice, tricky trading with other players and you need to take memory of what other players collect.

It's fundamentally based on humour and satire on italian politic, economy and showbusiness.

Name: Race for the Galaxy: Rebel vs Imperium
Description:
This second expansion for Race for the Galaxy delves into the growing conflict between the Rebel and Imperium forces. Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm expansion is optional, but is strongly recommended and adds solo play. Rebel vs Imperium adds an extra player so with the 1st expansion allows 6-player game. The drafting variant now supports 2-5 players (instead of just 2-3 with The Gathering Storm).

This expansion increases player interaction by adding takeover rules that allow players to conquer military worlds in other players' tableaus, though players who refrain from playing certain cards are immune to conquest. A new "Mix and Match Explore" power allows a player to combine the explore cards with their hand before discarding.  Three new start worlds increase the number of start worlds to 12 and allow players a choice of a military or non-military start world.  New goals are also included.  Finally there is a 2-player Rebel vs Imperium scenario.

Name: Quiz Me: Game of Geography
Description:
Perhaps one of the older trivia games published, Quiz Me: Game of Geography is simply a trivia game with trick questions. The player who answers the most questions correctly wins.

For example: Question #10 is "Singapore is an important naval base in the East Indies belonging to Great Britain.  True or False?"

The answer is "True."

Game #4777 made in 1940 by Milton Bradley Co. of Springfield, Mass.

Name: Intervention divine
Description:
In this french-only collectible card game, 2 players (one being God, the other one being Satan) are trying to gain control over different populations, using angels or demons, respectively.

While various actions can be undertaken, some including fighting, the core of the game involves trying to seduce humans using either sex, money or power.

This card game is based on a role-playing game called "In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas", also by Croc.

The game had an extension (also ccg) called "Cult movies" and a limited edition called "the bible" with all cards with "bords dorés" ( in french)

Name: Geheimkonferenz
Description: Players hold people cards from different nations and task cards. The task cards specify certain sets of people cards which have to be collected. This is done by simply exchanging 1-6 cards with new ones from the stack. When a player fulfills a task, he or she puts down the people cards, draws new cards and continues. In the end, the player with most people cards (points) in front of him/her, wins.

Name: Sindbad: Das große Abenteuer-Spiel
Description:
A simple roll-and-move game, similar to Snakes and Ladders. Themed as an Arabian nights adventure of german TV series hero, Sindbad.

(For those of you who remember: watch the intro of the series here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aK6Hf0IYst4)

Name: Great War at Sea: Reichsmarine
Description:
In June 1919, 11 battleships, five battle cruisers, eight light cruisers and 50 destroyers of the German High Seas Fleet attempted to scuttle themselves in the British anchorage at Scapa Flow. Most of the crews succeeded, and the enraged Allied Powers soon stripped Germany of her remaining modern warships as well.

The mass sinking at Scapa Flow did clear up one diplomatic flashpoint: Some American naval staff officers feared they would be incorporated into the Royal Navy and used in an Anglo-American conflict. As punishment for the German act of defiance, the Allies seized all remaining German dreadnought battleships and modern cruisers, plus 400,000 tons of floating cranes and drydocks and other equipment and all submarines. Germany's new Wiemar Republic would have to build its new Reichsmarine around a core of aging ships already docked as obsolete by the old Imperial Navy.

Reichsmarine is a Great War at Sea supplement exploring the alternate history possibilities had the High Seas Fleet not been scuttled. Just like Second World War at Sea: Imperial & Royal Navy, it comes as a .pdf download: You get everything right away, but you will have to assemble the playing pieces yourself. It has everything you expect in a naval game supplement: scenarios, ship data sheets, and playing pieces.

The supplement includes ten scenarios, or separate game situations, based on battles that might have been waged by the Royal Navy or Weimar Germany. The ships lost at Scapa Flow are all present in British colors; those surrendered afterwards are in the colors of Weimar Germany. Plus, one-inch "long" pieces are provided for Royal Navy destroyer leaders. This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of Jutland, Mediterranean, U.S. Navy Plan Gold and Sea of Troubles to enjoy all of the scenarios.

Reichsmarine is sold exclusively via .pdf download. The playing pieces are not die-cut-and-mounted, nor are the scenario book or the ship data printed. Instead it comes as a series of .pdf files that will need to be assembled into the game's components.
Families: Series: Great War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

Name: Babel
Description:
In Babel each player gets ten cards and trades cards with the other players in an attempt to form poker combinations. When a player has a good enough hand - two five-card combinations which are high enough, or a ten-card straight or flush - they go out. When a player reaches a certain target score the game ends.

With three to five players a single deck is used and players all sit at the same table. Trading is free-form and players may trade unequal numbers of cards. If trading bogs down and all players agree, they all draw one card from the deck but do not discard any (obviously not possible with five players). A player must have two combinations of flushes or better (or a ten-card set) to go out; when a player goes out the hand ends and all players score. Combinations lower than flush still score for the players not going out. If players drew extra cards only ten can be scored.

With more than five players multiple decks are used and the game is played as a party game with players circulating around the room. All trades must be equal since no extra cards can be drawn. When a player has two combinations of straight or better (or a ten-card set) they can take their hand to be scored and get a fresh hand. Pairs and triplets are not scored. This version is called Super-Babel in some editions.

Name: The Bringing Up Father Game
Description:
George McManus' Bringing Up Father (a.k.a. Maggie And Jiggs) was a very popular newspaper strip of the early 20th century. This is a simple race game based on the strip, for up to four players.

The strip centered around Jiggs, an Irishman who comes into wealth in the United States. Even so, he still wants to keep his old pals and eat corned beef and cabbage at Dinty Moore's tavern, much to the consternation of his bourgeois wife, Maggie. The constant warfare between them is the source of much of the humor.

The game features the strip's characters as playing pieces and their surroundings as the playing board.

Name: Rope
Description: Rope is a game of patterns and quick reaction, inspired by the classic game Ricochet Robot.  Player must recreate the pattern or not flipped up from the deck of cards using their own pieces of rope and rings.

Name: Bee-Line
Description:
From the box:
The simple strategy game for all the family, with easy-to-learn rules for two to four players, aged five years and upwards.

The Bees are returning to their beehive, after a busy day collecting pollen in the meadow.  Players have to get their Bees into the honeycomb without upsetting the other Bees.

It seems easy at first but the Bees have a sting in their tails and it's not as simple as it looks!

Quick Summary:
Each turn, a player must place one of the four bees in their colour onto the 4 by 4 "honeycomb", but each placed bee must be placed in an empty cell and may not "see" another bee of the same colour.  If you can not place a bee, then you are out of the game and the last player to place a bee wins.

Name: ProletaRatz
Description: It is a paper-and-counters, print-and-play boardgame for 3-4 players where every player tries to control the city sewers and builds the happiest, biggest rat community.

Name: Garden Plots
Description:
Players try to develop their gardens starting with Garden Plot, Plant Food, and Water cards.  After these requirements are met, sets of flower cards may be sown.  Opponents can slow your progress by playing a Drought card on your garden, but you can counter with more Water or a Sprinkler System. The first player to sow 5 sets of flowers wins the hand.

The deck contains three different cards for each flower (suit). The cards contain information such as botanical name, pronunciation, common name, horticultural information, and name derivation. The cards also depict quaint watercolors of each flower.

The information on the cards can also be used as a trivia game along with the included lists of Bonus Game questions.

Name: Joel Harden's Mogul
Description:
The game was designed, according to the press release announcing it, by a Philadelphia real estate mogul. Players move along a track similar to that of Monopoly or Life. On certain squares, players are allowed to draw a series of cards from different decks -- the deed, condition and ownership decks -- to put together profiles of properties. Once the property is created, it may be purchased. Other spaces allow potential tenants to be found. Players must also use forms and charts to keep track of the ongoing amortization costs as well as the ongoing costs.

The game ends when a player reaches a predetermined net worth. The game suggests $500,000, $1 million or $5 million.

Name: Dungeons & Dragons: Een spannend avonturenspel
Description:
(translated from the dutch text on the back of the box)

A family game for 2-4 players aged 8 or older.

Story:

The terrible dragon has struck again, this time he has kidnapped 8 beautiful girls and hid them in his cave.

You - as the brave player - have decided to rescue the girls and return them to safety.

But be careful of the dragon or he will surely surpise and hurt you!

Aim:

Be the first to rescue 2 girls from the dragon's cave.

Name: Battlestar Galactica: Colonial Battlefleet
Description:
This game is intended to replicate the feel of space combat as it appears on the new Battlestar Galactica show that airs weekly on the SciFi channel.

To play the game you will need:
- Miniatures or counters to represent the spaceships
- Miniatures or counters to represent missiles and torpedoes (a lot of them!)
- Several each of six sided, eight sided, ten sided, and twelve sided dice (d6,d8,d10,d12)
Note: In some places you will be required to roll one or more d9’s. To roll a d9, roll a d10 normally, but treat the 10 as a zero.
- Printouts of the ship combat record for each ship participating in the battle
- A battle mat marked in hexes large enough to accommodate your ship models/counters.

The game is designed to be simple to learn and fast paced, yet still provide an engaging tactical experience that will provide countless hours of fun.

The object of the game is to destroy your enemy’s fleet. The cylons accomplish that by hanging back with their carriers and sending wave after wave of missiles and fighters at the colonial fleet, possibly accompanied by Cylon battleships, trying to overwhelm the Colonial defenses.

Conversely, the colonials want to get in as close as possible to the cylon base carriers so that they can pound them into so much scrap with their powerful rail guns.
You may also wish to create scenarios with other objectives as well, perhaps based on sequences from the show, such as the battle at Ragnar Station, or simply scenarios you dream up yourself.

Name: Card Bowl
Description:
Card Bowl reproduces the game of football using standard playing cards.

The game balances strategy and chance, and almost anything that happens in a real football game can happen in Card Bowl, including runs, passes, sacks, fumbles, interceptions, punts, field goals, etc.

Special teams plays

Cards representing different values are simply drawn in a certain order, and modifiers applied to determine results (e.g. spot where kickoff is received and yardage returned).

Scrimmage plays - Version 1 (Complex)

Each player is dealt eleven cards representing players, and spreads them out on the table in formation, face down. The cards are then moved and turned over in a generally specified manner and order, in alternating turns, which represents the development of the play. In addition, at certain points of action, cards are turned over from the remaining deck, which represent the element of chance and the unanticipated dynamics of the game.

The scrimmage play evolves around match-ups between offensive and defensive cards, with the values and modifiers determining the outcome. Multiple cards on each side plus drawn cards may be involved in one match-up.

At some point during one of its turns, the offensive player executes a play (e.g. hands off the ball, throws a pass). Cards from each hand that are directly involved in the play are then added along with drawn cards, and the offensive and defensive values are compared to determine the outcome.

The scrimmage plays can actually replicate the flow and dynamics of a real play.

The game does require a lot of addition, so being able to add quickly is also helpful.

Scrimmage plays - Version 2 (Simplified)

Each team has its own deck of cards (of course team playing cards would be ideal). A third deck is used as the neutral Draw Deck. For each play from scrimmage, each player selects four cards from his own deck. After each play, these four cards are placed in that player's used card pile, and can't be used again until the deck is exhausted. Thus the entire deck is used in 13 plays, then each player starts over with the whole deck.

For each play, each player places four cards from his deck face down representing players. The cards are all turned face up, and the offense chooses which card/player the play goes to based on the type of play he wants to run and the most advantageous matchup. Additional cards are then drawn from the Draw Deck and added to each player's side of the matchup. Cards involved in the play are then added along with drawn cards, and the offensive and defensive values are compared to determine the outcome. Fumbles, sacks, incomplete passes and interceptions can occur.

For complete instructions, play diagrams and change history, see Web Links.

Name: La ruta de las mariquitas
Description:
[EN] The ladybugs go hunting, and they want to hunt as many lice as possible. After shuffling cards, they are arranged in a 10 x 6 grid and each team of ladybugs should cross from one end of the grid to the other, trying to be the first to arrive.

[ES] Las mariquitas están de cacería, y quieren conseguir pulgones. Tras barajar las fichas, se disponen en posicion de 10 x 6 y cada equipo de mariquitas debera cruzar de extremo a extermo  intentando llegar el primero.

[CA] Les marietes van de cacera i volen caçar molts pugons. Després de barrejar les fitxes, es disposen en una posició de 10 x 6 i cada equip de marietes ha de creuar d'un extrem a l'altre, intentant arribar-hi en primer lloc.

Name: Ki az úr a tengeren?
Description:
The game was first published around the '80-es. This post belong to the 2008 edition.

A fierce war is to be done for the transporting between the continents. Who will be the winner who can pan the most trading power to the sea. The sailors must fight again pirates storms epidemics and the other incalculable dangers of the sea. You can taste all these in this adventurous game. You must make hard economical decisions. The game bits remind us of the contemporary wood-engraving, causing great excitement of this unforgettable game.

Name: The Terrific Tuatara Trail Game
Description: From the publisher: Travel through time and rediscover New Zealand’s rich historical past.  Answer questions as you go, and earn points by collecting worms, wetas, millipedes and beetles. The player with the largest collection of delicious tuatara treats at the end of the journey wins the game!

Name: Starlo Fishing Forever Australia
Description:
From game's website:
"The aim of the game is to travel around Australia, trying to catch at least one of each of the country’s 14 most popular fish. During the trip you will meet with all the trials and tribulations, as well as the excitement, you would encounter during the ‘real’ thing.
You will learn about some of Australia’s most sought after fish, their habitats, and the methods of catching them, while gaining good fishing habits and the right attitude towards maintaining this magical resource, so we can go on ............FISHING FOREVER."

Home Page: http://fishingforevergames.com/

The name "Starlo" in the title is a typically Aussie abbreviation of Steve Starling's name.

Name: Rex-a-Round
Description:
Each player is attempting to feed Rex by shooting egg tokens into his mouth. Trouble is Rex won't sit still and his rotating head and moving mouth make this game a more involved version of Tiddly Winks for young children and parents alike.

Game requires 2 'AA' Batteries to play.

Name: Disney's Bernard und Bianca im Känguruhland
Description: Based on the Disney movie "The Rescuers Down Under" you play as Bernard, Bianca, Jake or Krebbs, who try to rescue Cody and the animals from the poacher McLeach's ranch. The players can use several ways of transport, like going on foot or use the help of animals offering them the chance to move faster for the price of gold coins. The first one, who reaches the ranch, wins. If more players achieve this goal in the same round, the one, who has more gold coins, wins.

Name: Das Tiroler Spiel
Description:
"Das Tiroler Spiel" (The Tirolean Game) is a Roll and Move Trivia game with over 600 questions about the tirolean part of the Alps. It is produced in german only!

2 - 6 players move their pawns along the valleys in the alps and try to answer questions in seven categories (History, People, Nature, Buildings, Society, Places and Culture)
When answering a question they earn points in the category of the question.
Players may switch earned points when landing on the same field.
There are special places of interest where players get special points that can be used as points for any category.
The first to answer at least one question in six of the seven categories and three in one category is the winner.
There are two different levels of difficulty of the trivia cards.
Each time a question is answered falsely a special pointer is dropped and if it reaches Zero ALL players loose the game.

Name: Peiper At The Gates: A NUTS! Supplement
Description:
Scenario book for Nuts!

“I’d never been so damn cold. The snow was flying sideways like, we could hardly see a thing. I’d never seen a Panther before, and hearing it clanking up put the fear into me, right to my toes. They hit us hard and fast, knocked us dead. Fierce, them SS Krauts. Even though they were people just like us, scared all to Hell, they fought like no one else. That was The Bulge to me; freezing cold, Kraut tanks, and horror. Horror all around me. Even when we started winning.” 
-Conversation with Lee Johnson, 391st Engineers, Ardennes veteran.

On December 16th, 1944, three German Panzer Armies hurled themselves at surprised Allied lines in the Ardennes area. This desperate bid to drive to the English Channel for a second time, attempting to recapture the port of Antwerp and forcing the Allies to sue for peace, would be called The Battle of the Bulge. In the end, this massive offensive would fail, costing the Germans the war. But it could have gone differently. PEIPER AT THE GATES is a mini-campaign of branching linked scenarios set during the advance of Kampfgruppe Peiper and the 1st SS Panzer Division towards the Meuse River.

Smash through all opposition as the Germans, capturing the bridges at Trios Ponts and driving into the American far-rear. Hold the Panzer advance at Stavelot, stopping them cold with a small rag-tag band of American fighting men. Fight the climatic battle of a lone King Tiger against massed Sherman tanks as Task Force McGeorge attacks the La Gleize Cauldron from the north. Play solo or with friends. Play the Germans. Play the Americans. But just play. The fate of the Western Front is in your hands.

Name: The Checkered Game of Life
Description:
Around 1860, Abraham Lincoln grew a beard.  A young printer, Milton Bradley, who had been making a living selling pictures of a beardless Lincoln now found himself without a salable product.  He turned to making board games, and invented The Checkered Game of Life.

Similar to Snakes and Ladders, The Checkered Game of Life has players moving on the board depicting virtues and vices.  Unlike "Snakes & Ladders," players have (limited) movement choices during the game.

Each turn, players spin a top to generate a random number, then consult a chart which gives them 2-4 movement options. If a player stops in a space which gives them points, they record these points on their chart.

The winner of the game is the first to accumulate 100 points.

This is the long predecessor to The Game of Life which is produced by the company that bears his name.

Name: Mini Skittles
Description:
Mini Skittles consists of 10 wooden pins, approximately 2.5 inches in height, and one wooden ball, approximately 1.25 inches in diameter.  The pins are set up by hand on a smooth floor or low-pile carpet.  The ball is used to knock them down.  Instructions are included for three different games. The games can be played by 2-5 individuals or teams with an equal number of players. 
 Skittles uses nine pins in a diamond formation. Scoring is based on the number of pins knocked down within a given number of throws.

Ten-pin Bowling uses all ten pins in a traditional triangular pattern.  Scoring is based on the number of pins knocked down within ten frames, with bonuses for spares and strikes.

Canadian Five-pin Bowling uses five pins in a vee formation.

Name: Alphabet Runner Cards
Description:
FREE-PRINT-PLAY: 14 Unique Free Alphabet Cards.

Alphabet Runner® cards are versatile and easy to use.
The cards are used to play fun games such as Snap, Pairs and a Word game.

Alphabet Runner® has received the Good Toy Guide Award 2006, Best Family Game UK Games Expo 2007, The Best Innovation Finalist 2006 and IAB Small Outstanding Business Finalist 2007.
 With five years on research and development and having had a stand at the UK Toy Fair for three years and The Educational Show NEC.
The Alphabet Runner® 2007 UK Championship Tournament was held at the UK Games Expo.

The cards can be downloaded in pdf file absolutely free. Print two A4 pages and cut out the cards and then laminate to feel the full effect.

Name: Alphabet Dice
Description:
From the instruction guide:

"Introduce an element of play with these fun-to-use Alphabet Dice.  These extra-large sized dice can be useful for stimulating many word and spelling games.

This guide is not intended to be a comprehensive set of notes for the dice, but rather an offering of a variety of games and activities which are sure to generate many more ideas by both you and your students.

The set consists of 12 dice.  Two dice have only vowels printed on the six sides.  The other ten dice have a combination of consonants, vowels and blends printed on the six sides.  The letters are arranged on the die with the more commonly used letters appearing most often.  Following is a chart indicating how often each letter or blend appears in the set."

a-4 
b-2 
c-2 
ch-2
ck-2
d-2 
e-6
f-2
g-2
h-2
i-2
j-2
k-2
l-2
m-2
n-3
o-4
p-2
qu-2
r-4
s-2
sh-2
t-2
th-2
u-3
v-2
w-2
x-2
y-2
z-2

Games suggested in the instructions:
Make A Word (3 to 5 players)
Write A Word (4 to 5 players)
Nonsense Words or Not? (2 players)
What's the Word? (4 to 5 players)
along with other suggested games

Interesting is the fact that the same letter has different values on different dice.  For example, the letter "a" has a value of 1, on the dice with all vowels (a,e,e,i,o,u) but the same letter "a" has a value of 3, on a mixed die with vowels and consonants (a,l,n,o,p,r).  Also, there are five blends:  ch (worth 5), ck (worth 6), qu (worth 6), sh (worth 5), and th (worth 5).

Name: Luck
Description:
Luck

The 1943 edition of Luck is a set of 15 games, all to be played with the same five dice.  The games are Ace in the Pot, African Golf, Beat the Banker, Black Cat, Dice Black Jack, Dice Draw Poker, Dice Race Horse, Floradora Sextette, Help Your Neighbor, Hi-Lo, Hooligan, Multiplication, Up and Down the River, Put and Take, and Yatzie (Yacht, a forerunner of Yahtzee), the best known game in the package.

The 1953 edition adds a sixth die and 15 more games: Barbudi, Big Dick, Black Dice, Bunco, Cross out the Numbers, Dice Baseball, Dice Ten Pins, Dice Tic-Tac-Toe, Drop Dead, Going to Boston, High Dice, Rotation, Round the Spot, Thirty Six, and Under and Over.

Some of these games may be Reginald Leister's own creations, but most of them (such as Yatzie) are dice games which had been played for decades.  Leister may be the first to publish rules to some of these.

The box says "New and Hilarious fun for 2 to 20 people". This game was produced by the Leister Game Company of Toledo, Ohio.

Name: Warmaster Renaissance Supplement
Description:
This self published variant was released shortly after the original Warmaster, as a modification of those rules for the Renaissance period.  It is interesting that this work pre-dates Games Workshop's Warmaster Ancients.

From the introduction of this title:


These rules are meant to supplement the Warmaster fantasy miniatures rules produced by Games Workshop, and incorporate the ancient rules supplement for that system developed by Stephen Hess. Our thanks to Mr. Hess for taking the time to assemble the basic troop types for the vast majority of troops available in the ancient period, as well as providing many prepared armies lists, and for graciously allowing me to directly incorporate his work into this piece. This supplement for Renaissance gaming is heavily dependent on the work done for the ancient period. Especially useful were the basic infantry, cavalry and elephant troop types. Rules incorporated here are elite, skirmishers, phalanx, warband, and camels. Stephen Hess’s Ancientmaster rules supplement can be found on the web http://www.brumbaer.de/Wm/Ancients/index.html.


Also included are guidelines for creating army lists from other sets which focus on this period, WRG 7th ed. & DBR.

Name: Riddles & Riches: Expansion Set 1 Silver Edition
Description: And now there is a whole new deck of riddles and corresponding hints for use with any edition of Riddles & Riches - The Riddles & Riches Expansion Set #1!

Name: Fangt die Mäuschen!
Description: A childrens game with similarities to "Fox and Geese". The player playing the mice must get 8 of his 12 mice into the larder to win, the other must prevent it. Simple game, but with very nice plastic mice.

Name: Weird New Jersey: Weird U.S. Booster Pack
Description:
This expansion adds several new characters and locations to the base game.

Publisher's description:
"There’s nothing garden variety about Garden State Weirdos! Welcome to where it all began: the great state of New Jersey.  You’ve already gotten weird with Weird U.S. The Game, now it’s time to get weirder with Weird Booster Pack Volume 1: N.J.  

Join the New Jersey Devil, the Hoboken Monkey Man, Buckeye the Football Playing Ghost, the Big Red Eye, Pig Lady and the Beast of Buttonwoods in collecting travelers at legendary places like the Albino Village of Clifton and the Devil’s Tower in Tenafly, and fight for your right to be the last Weirdo standing! Or at least the last Weirdo standing in New Jersey

Based on the stories from Weird N.J. by Mark Moran and Mark Sceurman. "

Expands:

     Weird U.S.: The Game

Name: Berlin-Stadtspiel
Description: A promotional game published by the Berlin Senate's public relations office, this is a simple game where players move around the town on a replica of a 1914 city map, collecting picture cards as they go. The most valuable set of cards wins. Movement can be along streets (slow) or using the underground/suburban railway. The game is historically interesting as it still shows the city divided by the Berlin Wall into Wast (Soviet) and West sectors, with only a few dedicated transit points between the two, a state of affairs that lasted from August 1961 to November 1989.

Name: Chinese Word Building Game
Description:
Players build a chain of words using tiles containing Chinese words, radicals and strokes.  Each adjacent pair of tiles must combine to form a word.

By way of comparison with English, it is akin to creating a string of compound words where the second part of the first word is the first part of the following word.  For example:  seahorse -> horseman -> manpower -> powerhouse -> household.

This game is similar to Chinese Characters Puzzle (Radicals V1.0).

Name: Casino Quiz
Description:
Bet and then answer the question. If you feel sure of yourself bet more. Casino Quiz is a combination of trivia and gambling with 720 questions from various categories. You can bet up to four times the odds of the question, if you bet and answer wrong you'll lose points. The electronic "roulette wheel" keeps track of points, answers and bets.

Mfg suggested age: Ages 12 and up

Awards

     2005 Ã…rets Voksenspil (Denmark), Winner, Best Adult Game


Components

     1 electronic control box
     360 question cards
     16 value markers (4 x 1,2,3 and 4)

Name: Combat Commander 1973-1983: Battlefield Command – Land Combat in the 1980's
Description: Battlefield Command is an "update and expansion" of Combat Commander. "By using rules in Battlefield Command in conjunction with Combat Commander, an extremely accurate 'advanced game' is achieved."

Name: Combat
Description:
From the rules:
  COMBAT, the new war card game, is inspired by the popular TV show. Players mix both skill and strategy with risk and luck to "capture" as many weapons as they are able.
  In the pack of 40 cards are 32 weapon card...which show a NUMBER, INSIGNIA and a WEAPON. The NUMBER on the WEAPON card is the point VALUE of the card in scoring. The remaining 8 cards are "CAPTURE" cards. They show a NUMBER and WEAPON. There are 2 CAPTURE cards of each WEAPON. These cards are used at strategic times to "capture" as many WEAPON cards as possible."

Name: Astralement vôtre
Description:
The goal is to reach special squares on the board. 
Possible actions for pawns are: jump over another, neutralize an opponent or run away, depending upon the astrological signs of each involved pawn.

Name: Bibifoc et les ours
Description:
The box is designed after the hero of a TV cartoon. Several classical games are included in the box: Seven Families, Bingo, Draughts and the original game Bibifoc et les ours.
The latter is a game of pawns with several similarities to Draughts.

Name: Table Bowls
Description:
Played seriously in parts of Northern England and Australia, Table Bowls gives Snooker and Pool players something new and fun. The game is played just like bowls on a lawn except each wood is carefully aimed using a special wooden chute.

A skillful game for two players, table bowls is designed to be played on a billiards table or other flat surface.

There are two different sizes of table bowls - 5.1cm (2 inch) and 5.7cm (2 1/4 inch) in diameter and two corresponding sets. Each set consists of a hardwood chute, an unbiased jack and 4 pairs of table bowls.

The 2 inch set features 4 pairs of bowls, each pair with a different bias. Jack is 1.25 inches diameter. 
The bowls in the 2 1/4 inch set all have the same bias. Jack is 1.5 inches diameter.

Name: Aquaretto: The Trains
Description:
The Trains is a small expansion for Aquaretto consisting of 18 tiles which have either one of four different-colored trains or curves.  These are mixed in with the other tiles and taken off trucks just like those tiles.

The trains are added to any empty space in your zoo and each different type of train (the four colors and the curve) in your zoo scores 2 points and each type in your depot scores minus two points at the end of the game.

This expansion was part of the second collection of mini-expansions sold by Rio Grande for Zooloretto, which also included Zooloretto: Job Boards, Zooloretto: The Gorilla, Zooloretto: The Savings Book, and Aquaretto: Three Coworker Tiles.

Also available as part of the Zooloretto: Goodie-Box.

Name: Playing Gods: Expansion Pack
Description:
For Playing Gods players who wish to delve deep into the well of blasphemy (or just want to see deluxe cards with full-color images of the gods), here's an Expansion Pack with 30 deluxe cards specific to the five major religions. They provide special attacks and defenses based on each religion's characteristics, and are easily incorporated into the existing rules and card decks. You can even create your own attacks!

Includes:
- 30 new cards
- 5 blank cards

Expands:

    Playing Gods: The Board Game of Divine Domination

Name: Tri-Casa
Description:
Tri-Casa is a fun and easy-to-learn card game for family and friends. If you like Rummy and Mille Bornes, you'll love Tri-Casa. This game is sure to be a hit with your family on vacations, camp outs, or an evening at home. English and Spanish instructions are included.

Similar to the play in Rummy, players receive seven cards to begin and draw from the deck or discard pile to begin each turn. Player discards one card to signal the end of the turn. The object of the game is to collect groups of three houses of the same color or three houses at consecutive addresses on the same street. Players lay down collections to gain the 10 points on each of the cards. A player can match a fixer-upper house with a cash card for 25 points. There is an old fire station card and an old church card that can be played alone and worth 25 points each.

Like Mille Bornes, this game has a few roadblocks. A player can play a Haunted House card or a Termite card on an opponent. The opponent cannot lay down any point cards until the proper remedy card is played, which is a Medium or Exterminator. If the player has the Home Inspection Team card displayed, the player is exempt from Termite or Ghost troubles.

Hands end when a player runs out of cards. Don't get caught with a lot of points in your hand, as they are subtracted from the points you have collected on the table. Play continues until a player reaches 500 points.

Learn more at www.tricasagame.com.

Name: SESSION 'Bottlecap' Rock Paper Scissor GAME
Description:
Using SESSION 'bottlecaps' having inner depictions with 2 kinds of each for these with a total of 6 now, then you can PLAY out "Rock, Paper, Scissor" games. Each participant shall utilize ONE complete 'Set' of "RPS" 'bottlecaps' for these during their PLAY, or in the case with "Solitaire" then ALL for that lone player.

"Solitaire" Method: Place ALL of those face-down and then pick 2.

"Fog of War" Method: Place ALL 3 of them in your HAND and then each player picks 1 to display their selection.

"Blind Pick" Method: Place ALL of them face-down and then each player selects theirs for comparison.

"Down Under Wonder" Method: Place your 3 'bottlecaps' in your hand with that behind you, then choose one randomly and whip it out!

Name: Mälumängudoomino
Description:
Mälumängu Doomino (Trivia Dominoes) is a boardgame that puts a trivia element into the well known dominoes game. The tiles have two categories marked on them, out of total ten. The tile placement follows normal domino rules, but each time you are placing a tile, you have to answer a question on the topic marked on the tile in question.

The game includes:
100 question cards with 1000 questions
55 domino tiles

The categories in the game are: history, people, nature, geography, science, entertainment, sports, Estonia, culture and varia

Name: Toby
Description:
Players begin the game with a Gold, entry level Credit Card and Cash as they journey around the gameboard leveraging on both Cash & Credit to win.

The Goal: To get your Black Card, acquire $2,500 Cash and have $0 worth of Debt.

Name: Teta Fuhu
Description:
Two or more players draw a small base of circles in their corner of a paper.  Each player stands their pencil on its end and slides it across the paper.  A new circle is drawn where the line ended, but the previous circle stays in place.

If another player's circle is hit, then that circle is scribbled out.  Then, the "shooting" player takes another turn.  A player wins when all circles of other colors have been scribbled out.

Many variants allow for wall-like obstacles where circles stop or pits where if a line crosses it, that circle does not count.

Name: Cirkle Mind
Description:
Cirkle Mind is a must play board game.The strategy is based on your ability to memorize  the shapes and the colors of the players' pieces, which are not shown to your opponent. 
The Strategy of the movements, by associating the forms and the colors of the pawns, is vital. 
Goal of the game: to find the target (top piece) of the other player among 24 figurines (which have different colors and forms). To capture the units and to control the best spaces on the board. The combat system is similar to Stratego.  Beware: the black piece is the strongest one and if your pawn match shape and colour on the board, it gets a high defense value.
Another board game connected to the Series: Cirkle.

Name: CirKle WOM
Description:
Abstract board game introducing the terrain concept:the board position decide how your piece will move,according to the CIRKLE gaming concept .
Aim of the game is to capture the opponent pawns, upgrade to draughts (2 pieces) or tower (3 pieces) and occupying the 2 targets squares on the board. Games options available.
Ages 6 and up, 25 minutes playing time.

Name: Pokémon Board Game Book
Description:
Two players (or two teams) compete over four track-boards.  Track-boards are "customized" by one or two of the six double-sided Pokémon cards, each of which has a 7x8 grid of characteristics/activities of which about 15 show through cut-out windows in each track-board.

Each player controls three white tokens which move along the track as a result of a spinner, plus a coloured token that moves as a result of combat results.  Points are scored by combat results, or by completing track-boards.  Win by reaching 260 points, or by reducing your opponent to 0 (everyone starts at 130 points).

By careful choice of placement of the white tokens, players can focus on offence, defence, or movement along the track-board.

Name: Merchant Princes
Description:
It is a time of chaos in the ancient empire of 14th century Byzantium. Political, social and economic upheavals are pushing the old empire to breaking point. For clever merchants it is a time of great potential. Attempt to accumulate, trade, bribe, trick and manipulate your way to becoming the richest and most influential Merchant Prince in Byzantium.

Summary: Players assume the role of an inspired merchant in ancient Byzantium, determined to develop a trading empire across the region of Anatolia during the upheavals of the time. Each player has a different character and special power taken from a range of different neighbouring cultures. Players buy trade goods in far off markets to sell in the bazaars of Byzantium, while doing their utmost to undermine and obstruct their rivals and avoid the various historical hazards of the time. Players use Trader markers to purchase and move goods appearing across the board, avoiding dangerous local events and rival player skulduggery. Later in the game players can attempt to secure influential government roles worth bonus victory points but require each role to be voted upon by all players so bribery and deal making is a must! The player with the largest and most influential merchant empire at game end is given the title of Merchant Prince of Byzantium.

Name: Monopoly: Amiens
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Amiens, in France.

Name: Monopoly: Angers
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Angers, in France.

Name: Monopoly: Avignon
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Avignon, in France.

Name: Monopoly: Beauvais
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Beauvais, in France.

Name: Monopoly: Besançon
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Besançon, in France.

Name: Monopoly: Bourges
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Bourges, in France.

Name: Monopoly: Chamonix
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Chamonix, in France.

Name: Monopoly: Brest
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Brest, in France.
